title: Vastaya humans vs Vastaya inhumans
body:
I had an idea in light of the recent discussions of Neeko's character design, it being more humanoid similar to that of {{champion:103}} {{champion:497}} and {{champion:498}} opposed to being more inhuman/ animal-like similar to {{champion:107}} and {{champion:62}}.  Personally I don't mind Neeko being of the former, and I think the "she's a Vastayshai'rei" argument is a weak one, because making her design more animal-like still does nothing to distinguish her from **regular vastaya** such as Rengar. The "she can shape-shift hence she more human now" argument, while more reasonable it is equally as flawed. 
From what I gathered the main difference between Neeko and the regular Vastaya are her shape shifting abilities and the presence of flower petals on her head and tail, but I digress.

****

What I want to suggest is that if you really want a "Chameleon Neeko", we petition to have Riot create a more "Chameleon" version of Neeko that can be toggled between that and her humanoid form, her being a shape-shifter it would make sense if she canonically had multiple 'original' appearances. Perhaps it just changes her face and some textures, but if you really want to see even a slightly more chameleon version of Neeko its worth the discussion imo.

replies.body: To clarify.  Neeko is better, faster at shapeshifting.  Most Vastaya have some ability to change shape. Most arrive a shape that is comfortable, reflects the animal spirits connected to their tribe, and their own personality (needs wants).    So it might take Rakan a few minutes to change the color of his cloak-- or a few hours to give himself stylish new horns.   But he will always be kinda flashy looking -- because subconsciously he wants attention, and vaguely griffon like because that is what family and tribe reflect.

So basically, Neeko being a chameleon is 100% coincidental and nonessential to her abilities.
It's kinda funny that that aspect of her character seems more important for communicating gameplay than actual storytelling, whereas most other Vastaya's animals are pretty inconsequential to their gameplay.
With this explanation, maybe she just likes colors and once saw a chameleon change colors so she borrowed the looks admiring the ability.
Exactly.   Because she liked changing=== she (and her tribe) we attracted to an animal spirit that is good a changing.

You mean cute tail right?
Nothing besides her tail is chameleon-esque in design.
her webbed fingers and toes, her scales, and her slime production?

Her fingers and toes aren't webbed. In both her splash or her model they are human.
Also those aren't even Chameleon traits. 
This is what a chameleons hand looks like; https://userscontent2.emaze.com/images/cfe01a8f-3e82-48ac-9e2a-a2d87b53ba3a/e713d4f5-8bc5-4e0c-8a97-adff5a6e042a.png

Which imo would of been a much more interesting design choice to go for then just human hands with rainbow paint. 

Chameleon's don't produce slime either, they're tropical reptiles, not amphibians.
Chameleon don't have webbed feet or slime (a sticky tongue is not the same as slinging slime with your hands).

These 2 comments puts it into perspective a ton of a lot better, thank you for the clarification!
****
Also, {{champion:497}}, horns and ~~vaguely~~ griffon all in the same paragraph... I need more of this in my life.

Related to the new Nid color story instead of Neeko:

The vastaya that she rescues says "You called itâ€¦ human", but there are no spoken lines from Nidalee calling the hunter a human up to that point in the story, only narration.

Was this an oversight, or intentional? It seems far too glaring to be oversight; Riot is usually very good about these sorts of details.

If intentional, does it indicate that the vastaya (who was reptilian, with a wide mouth and a strange lisp) could read her mind the way that Neeko was able to get thoughts from the people whose form she copied? I.e. that the male vastaya that Nid rescued is actually another one of Neeko's tribe?

Edit: oh, or was that just actually Neeko in disguise?

Sorry haven't read it.   But it's true some Vastaya and human spiritwalkers (like Udyr) can hear (or even feel) your feelings and spirit as you might hear a birdsong of feel the warmth of the sun.   Being more connected to the spirit world also means they are more aware of the spirits of everything around them (i.e. souls)  and how those spirits are connected or broken.

The Vastayan Lizard said Nidalee wasn't Vastaya, although a rioter previously confirmed this, what exactly is Nidalee?

Is she just someone really close to the spirits?

Humans with vastaya herigitage arent considered Vastaya even though they retain some powers.

Interesting. Do you think there's a possibility of "transformed" skins for our Vastaya champions that show the more animistic ones looking more human and/or the more human ones with more animal characteristics? I'd love to see mostly-human Rengar or very-bird-like Xayah.

Ooh ok, this gives me ideas. Like, this seems to imply that their form is largely based on their subconscious mind, and that most could theoretically change their appearance to a much higher level than they currently do, but that it'd require either an deep deep understanding of ones own mind or some other sort of mental training. Now if this is the case what would a Vastayan with split personalities or some other similar mental condition look like. It'd be really neat to see a champ who could like form swap between two personalities, sure Kayn and Gnar sort of already touch on this but I feel like there's still plenty of room here for something really neat. Like maybe have some sort of in game conditions that would trigger the change outside of what we're used to. Maybe they could have something like a fear of groups and so being around more than one champ causes them to shift into a different form, sure Kha'zix kinda already plays around this but make them a laner and it could be really cool. Maybe they have like tank disengage qualities in groups, and more fighter/diver qualities solo, could be fun to try and balance around top/support as their main roles and would make them a really unique flex pick. Ok I'm gonna work more on this thought I like this.

Interesting. Considering she likes to blend with humans, does this mean her current appearance is meant to reflect her need to do so, or has she just always been like that?

Also now this gives me the idea for Spirit Guardian Neeko haha
Now that you mention it, Neeko actually would be a good choice if they wanted to expand that line.  And I didn't think it'd be possible to do it justice outside Udyr.
the big problem I see with Neeko is that half the time you wont be seeing your skin, so you'd need to do something pretty unique to stand out in the moments where you don't look like your teammates.
Yeah I like that they kept the Put helmet/full-cover on on Kai'Sa.

We'll never see a true Vastayashay'rei outside of longer stories because a true shapeshifter should be formless, any attempt to make it to human will be scoffed at (Neeko is written as though she is supposed to embody what the Vastayashay'rei are about with the caveat that she isn't ACTUALLY one of them, just closer to one because she can trace her lineage back to them. Kinda a cop out imo), and making it to animalistic will make people confused (why this form over another?).
